description.text: IOA YANG module with common typde definitions and groupings.
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.2
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R4.1
Base identity for all types of entities that can be addressed via AID.
NE function.
Internet Key Exchange version 2 peer.
Internet Key Exchange version 2 local instance.
Data path encryption secure entity (SecY).
IPSec security policy database entry.
OC-N (SONET)
STM (SDH)
Optical Carrier level 192, also known as SONET.
Optical Carrier level 48, also known as SONET.
Synchronous Transport Module hierarchy 64, also known as SDH.
Synchronous Transport Module hierarchy 16, also known as SDH.
Network Media Channel
Media Channel
Optical Physical Termination Point
Optical Multiplex Section
Optical Supervisory Channel
Optical Transport Section
Optical Transmission Section, with Reduced scope
Amplifier
Raman Amplifier
Pump
Raman Supervisory Channel
Fiber Channel
Percentage
A custom type for entity (managed object) name
A custom type for certificate name.

List of numbers using ',' as separator and '..' to represent ranges.
Examples: '12' , '1..4' , '1,5,10..12,20'

List of numbers using ',' as separator and '..' to represent ranges.
Examples: '1.2' , '1.1..1.4' , '1.1,1.5,1.10..1..12,1..20'
Typedef for a timestamp 'date+time' or the keyword 'never'.
Typedef for a timestamp 'date+time' or 'time' only or the keyword 'never'.

Timestamp with hours-minutes and optionally seconds.
Leading zero is required (04:00 instead of 4:00).
Examples:
   23:00     (same as 23:00:00)
   01:43:30
Typedef for a timestamp 'date+time' or 'time' only.

Time interval using the following syntax:
   '[xw] [xd] [xh] [xm] [xs]'
where:
   w(eeks), d(ays), h(ours), m(inutes), s(seconds).
Examples:
   2w          - two weeks
   5d 12h      - 5 days and 12 hours
   1h 7m 30s   - 1 hour and 7 minutes and 30 seconds
Generic enabled switch.
Generic address, may be an IPv4, IPv6 or a hostname for DNS resolution.
A generic storage or file size, in megabytes.
Generic type definition for a user-name attribute.

Generic type definition for a password attribute.
Password characters may only include spaces, numbers, letters and ASCII symbols.
Minimum length and password complexity rules are defined via security policy.

A format for representing binary data as printable text.
https://rfc.zeromq.org/spec/32/
Generic type definition for a db-passphrase attribute.
Session type.
Protocol used for session establishment.
Indicates services endpoint hierarchy.
Port number.
Re-usable grouping.

Passphrase used for encrypting and decrypting DB snapshots.
For each command associated with DB snapshots (backup, restore, etc),
this db-passphrase will be used, except when it is directly provided in each command.
Automatic DB snapshots will not be enabled until this parameter is set.

System configured circuit ID, present in XCONs and associated facilities.
For facilities, circuit-id is only filled in if an associated XCON exists.
   Format of this ID is:
   <timestamp>|<ne-name>|<XCON-AID>|<user-configured-sufix>
   Example:
   2020-05-05T21:06:02Z|GX|1-4-T9,1-4-L1-1-ODUji#1|my-suffix

   Timestamp is the NE time at xcon creation, in UTC.
   If necessary, ne-name will be truncated so that total length remains at 128 characters.
A set of attributes that are commonly applicable to every managed object supported by the system.
Oper states common to multiple objects.
The operational state of this object.
A grouping of system determined statuses.
Entity is in service.
Entity is out of service.
Entity is in normal operation.
Entity is in abnormal operation.
Entity is not available due to the related FRU being in low power mode.
Entity automatically locked by the system.
Entity manually locked by the user.
Entity is not available because the related FRU is not present.
Entity is not available because the actual FRU mismatches against the expected FRU type.
Entity is not assigned.
Entity is not available due to the related FRU is faulty.
Entity is not available due to the related FRU is partially faulty.
Entity is in maintenance mode.
Entity is not available due to the parent entity is faulty.
Facility is not available due to failure.
Auto-in-service (AINS) is active for the facility.
Entity is not available because the related FRU was shutdown.
Entity is in a diagnostic operation.
Entity is upgrading.
Entity has incomplete configuration.
Entity is reserved.
Availability state of an entity.
Admin states common to multiple objects.
The administrative state of the managed object.
States common to multiple objects.
Arbitrary user label
User label.
Set of leafs necessary to identify a resource by type and aid.
Type of resource.
Resource Access Identifier (AID). Identifies an instance within a specific resource type.
Resource Access Identifier. Used on equipments and mgmt protocols.
Set of attributes that are used to identity an individual resource instance.
Existing system resource.
Alternative way to represent a resource, using a resource type and an aid.
Advanced parameters/serdes attributes.
Name of the advanced parameter.
Value of the advanced parameter.
Parameter set.
Parameter unknown.
Parameter in progress.
Parameter failed.
Parameter not supported.
State of the advanced parameter (as observable on the system) once it is configured.
The current value for a supported advanced parameter.
Name of the advanced parameter.
Value of the advanced parameter.
Alarm Reporting Control grouping - to be added by all objects that support alarms (and therefore ARC).
Alarm reporting is allowed.
Alarm reporting is inhibited.
Controls the reporting of alarms for this particular object.
Common notification grouping - notification id and ne name.
NE name associated with this event.

Notification id associated with this event.
Notification id is a number that always increments with each notification,
and that with a system reboot will keep increasing (even with a buffer added to it),
guaranteeing that the id always grows.
Common software revision parameters.
Software revision currently installed.
Common property concept.
Type specific property, auto instanciated by the system, but configurable by the user.
Name of the property.
Value of the property. Will always be a 'string', even if it corresponds to a number or other type.
Description of this property, including type restrictions.
The assignment-method common to multiple objects.
Assignment method is both manual and dhcp.
Assignment method is manual.
Assignment method is dhcp.

The system would contain manual and dhcp configured values.
System can use those onfigurations/values defined by assignment-method attributes.
